title: Missed optimization to elide bounds check

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Context: this bug was reduced from indexing into a nested array, but this shows the same problem.

```rust
pub fn get(array: &[u8; 8], x: usize, y: usize) -> u8 {
    if x > 7 || y > 7 {
        0
    } else {
        array[y]
    }
}
```
([Playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=release&edition=2018&gist=eb99add1d3d6d8341bbb85feb75a5781))

Rust doesn't elide the bounds check on `array[y]`, even though it's impossible for `y` to be out of range due to the if condition. Rust does elide the bounds check when the if condition is just `if y > 7`, however.

Here is the generated ASM for the above code:
```asm
playground::get:
	pushq	%rax
	orq	%rdx, %rsi
	cmpq	$7, %rsi
	jbe	.LBB0_2
	xorl	%eax, %eax
	popq	%rcx
	retq

.LBB0_2:
	cmpq	$7, %rdx
	ja	.LBB0_5
	movb	(%rdi,%rdx), %al
	popq	%rcx
	retq

.LBB0_5:
	leaq	.Lanon.357673f8919c00a2ec2e627b7663c19f.1(%rip), %rax
	movl	$8, %esi
	movq	%rdx, %rdi
	movq	%rax, %rdx
	callq	*core::panicking::panic_bounds_check@GOTPCREL(%rip)
	ud2

.Lanon.357673f8919c00a2ec2e627b7663c19f.0:
	.ascii	"src/lib.rs"

.Lanon.357673f8919c00a2ec2e627b7663c19f.1:
	.quad	.Lanon.357673f8919c00a2ec2e627b7663c19f.0
	.asciz	"\n\000\000\000\000\000\000\000\005\000\000\000\t\000\000"
```

and here is the generated ASM when we change the if to just be `if y > 7`
```asm
playground::get:
	cmpq	$7, %rdx
	jbe	.LBB0_2
	xorl	%eax, %eax
	retq

.LBB0_2:
	movb	(%rdi,%rdx), %al
	retq
```


### Meta
This occurs in both the latest versions of stable (1.44.1) and nightly (1.46.0-nightly (2020-06-26 7750c3d46bc19784adb1))
